channel.title: [Project] New Site
channel.description:
[center][b]New Site[/b][/center] Hey everyone, I am going to make a site, that will be a part of moparscape, and not a wanna be forums. I figured, since this is web development, I would post it here. So basically I need a few people, I will do some of the HTML, I need someone that can do PHP, and someone that can do CSS, or HTML with me. [center] [b]Site Idea Summary[/b][/center] Okay, so basically this site is going to have a couple pages, a home page, a page with RS2 client codes, a page with RS2 Server codes, and a page with a list of new servers, that will be reset every week. [center][b]Who we need[/b][/center] We need a few kinds of coders, someone that is good with PHP, and someone that is good with CSS. After that we will start the site. Basically, I will make the 1st page in notepad then archive it, then send it to the person that will do PHP, they will code what they want on it, or touch it up, then archive it and send it to the person that does CSS, then they will code it and send it to me again, then I will keep it, and start the next page. [s]HTML Coder[/s]- Me, JaceRonald@live.com is my MSN. [u]PHP Coder[/u]- None [u]CSS Coder[/u]- None [u]Someone that is good with all three, and is willing to help with all 3[/u]- None To apply, use this format:
IRL Name: Spot Applying For: Why I should choose you: Examples of your work: MSN: Have you added my MSN:
[center][b]Site Name[/b][/center] I am thinking the site name will be [b]Moparscape2[/b], and will just be an add on to the moparscape forums. Hopefully one of the administrators likes this idea, and will allow us to do it. If not, we will rename it, and just not mooch off of this forums. If you can think of a better name, please post a suggestion below. [size=8pt]P.S. If this is against the rules, please have a moderator remove it.[/size]

item.title: [Project] New Site
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“Jace Ronald, post:11, topic:366859”][quote author=Greeny link=topic=463055.msg3387135#msg3387135 date=1288557635]

If I am going to spend the money to get a webhost, it is going to have to be good.

Why? Because webhosting is a lot of money?

I’m sorry, but you came here with a moparscape type recruitment thread, expecting us to “apply” to polish up your website. Which from what I understand, you will do some of the HTML and that is all. Baring in mind I wasn’t joking about it taking half an hour to finish your entire project. Plus, who passes along a project in a serial fashion. Wow, you need educating.
[/quote]

I don’t see what I did wrong, I just wanted to try and get a good team, and make a good website from scratch.[/quote]

The fact you don’t see a problem, is the problem.

OK. So let’s look at your thread. You’re telling me to join your team I’d have to provide examples of my work and admit to proficiency in either CSS, HTML or PHP.

Firstly, where’s examples of your work project leader? I would want proof the guy I’m going to be working for is as experienced or more so than me. Why?.. because presumably you’re going to load your site with ads and try to make a killing - I want to know I’m getting something in return, experience, money… whatever. If you’re less competent than me, then I could just make it myself and reap the rewards. (Presuming the initial idea was a good one- which it isn’t)

Second, no-one dabbles in just CSS, HTML or PHP. You learn all three or you’re not a competent web developer, end of. In fact, limiting yourself to just those for a website is pretty bland these days.

Finally,

I am thinking the site name will be Moparscape2, and will just be an add on to the moparscape forums.

Oh. My. God. And, I’m an atheist.

Read full topic

If I am going to spend the money to get a webhost, it is going to have to be good.
[/quote]

Why? Because webhosting is a lot of money?

I’m sorry, but you came here with a moparscape type recruitment thread, expecting us to “apply” to polish up your website. Which from what I understand, you will do some of the HTML and that is all. Baring in mind I wasn’t joking about it taking half an hour to finish your entire project. Plus, who passes along a project in a serial fashion. Wow, you need educating.[/quote]

I don’t see what I did wrong, I just wanted to try and get a good team, and make a good website from scratch.

Read full topic

You need to be educated before blabbering your condescending bullshit to members of a community you aren’t yet familiar with.
